data.title: Great find in Bloomington
data.text: Our son is in his last year at IU and we've visited Bloomington dozens of times. Last night, our son booked dinner at Finch's, where my wife and I had not previously dined. We had a group of 7 and the service was great. Meals were tasty and reasonable portioned. My wife and I both found our meals a bit bland, but side dishes were super. I had a bite of the special lamb ragu and wish I had ordered that rather than the cod.  Great draft beer selections. I hope we'll have the chance for a meal there again sometime. Perhaps a bit pricier than we felt appropriate, but it was busy on a football Saturday night, so I guess you can charge more if you can get it. No complaints.

data.title: Nice atmosphere, but not worth the price
data.text: We had a party of 7. The atmosphere is nice, if you do not care about price, this place is OK. But $16 for a 10" pizza is too much. The hamburger came with a red sauce for the french fries (no the red sauce was not ketchup, it was really bad.) When we asked for ketchup, they told us we make all of our sause's and what we got is all they had. Look to other places in Bloomington.

data.title: Very nice
data.text: While visiting here my fiancé and I had an amazing time. Staff was very knowledgeable and the food was spot on! Rabbit Cacciatore was extremely tasty and designer cocktails were our dessert! Beautiful area as well!!

data.title: Overpriced but ok
data.text: I have an "on again off again" relationship with Finch's. I have had fabulous meals that made me swoon and I have had meals that kept me from returning for months. Last night we had one of those mediocre experiences. It was our 44th wedding anniversary and, hoping Finch's would have a super daily meal, we went there to celebrate. The special was halibut, one of my favorites when prepared properly. I ordered that, though I was concerned that it would be prepared on their open hearth oven. My husband had his usual small pizza, which are always good. Sadly, the halibut arrived (very small portion for $32) and I could tell by looking at it that it was overcooked. Nevertheless, I tried it and, yes, it was dry and very salty. The bed of risotto looked appealing but I sent the meal back and asked for their brassiere burger. The burger was great, as were the fries and truffle aioli that came with it. But, $18 for a burger is a bit much. We will return but probably only for a luncheon pizza. The staff are always courteous and knowledgeable and, in this instance, very willing to make the meal right do me. I did appreciate that. You should try Finch's. They are local and they source good food. Just be mindful that they are expensive and sometimes the food isn't up to par, but they always try!

data.title: My Go Too Restaurant
data.text: Finch's is the go too restaurant in Bloomington, food is always good very consistent and the service is always good, sitting outside in Summer is wonderful. My friend had the duck and it was really good, I had the stake with Morels Mushrooms and it was delicious. It has a very good full bar and you can sit at the bar if that is your fancy and eat also.

data.title: Over rated
data.text: The food is overrated and expensive for what you receive.  I see them often listed as one of the best in Bloomington but I would not rate them in my top 10.

data.title: Great meal!
data.text: I loved this restaurant! We are here while dropping our daughter @ IU. The appetizers were excellent and all of the main courses were yummy! The gnocchi was beyond delicious and I would definitely order again. The Arrowhead apertif is great if you like different drinks. We sat outside and had a great time. I'm only doing 4 rating because it took a while to get our food but it was for sure worth the wait!!

data.title: Gem of a restaraunt!
data.text: Finch's was highly recommended to us by several people upon hearing we were traveling to visit IU and we were not disappointed!!  Finch's is an easy walk from IU campus, nestled in the heart of Kirkwood Avenue.  We arrived without a reservation and very casually dressed, and we're warmly welcomed and seated promptly at a very nice table--Wow--guess we're not in LA.  The menu choices were varied and enticing.  The beer and wine list good.  Our food was delicious and the service excellent.  The cozy atmosphere is warm and inviting.   I would highly recommend this great place!

data.title: The Gem of Bloomington's Food Scene
data.text:
On a recent extended holiday in Bloomington, we were so fortunate to visit this lovely little,French Brasserie located in the heart of city and it was our first night what a lovely welcome to the city, a bottle of exquisite Rose' on the patio watching the sunset. Even though it was close to closing we were graciously welcomed and encouraged to order if we wished. With a welcome so warm, we returned the next evening for an incredible evening, ordering the chefs special offerings and yet another bottle or two from there extensive, well selected wine list. The food was so pure and represented the best of local farms and purveyors. The wait staff was so attentive and not once did we have to beg for water refills as you would in major cities! Desert complimented the evening! 
We returned several times during our stay and found each visit more enchanting than the last. It is a must visit for those who appreciate lovely food, wine and service!!!

data.title: Brunch at Finch's
data.text: The brunch menu is somewhat limited, but has a few interesting things.  My mushroom frittata was nicely done.  Waitstaff is pleasant and responsive, but didn't remember to bring bread.  Lunch menu is more extensive:  check ahead to see when it's available.

data.title: Nice location. Good set menu for large party
data.text: Visited this restaurant for a business meal with a large group. We were given an upstairs private room which was light and airy. Food was good. Service great. Good selection of craft beers and knowledgeable waiter helped steer me through the options (some very strong beers - be careful). Would recommend for this type of function.

data.title: Always a fantastic meal!!
data.text: Met family there and thoroughly enjoyed the experience and the food.  We had a charcuterie plate with 5 options that were fantastic!  Great bottle of cab from Double T.

data.title: Mussels and duck breast, can't go wrong
data.text: The crisp/tender duck breast was cooked to perfection, while the mussels were full of flavor and (surprisingly) fresh. Will return for sure!

data.title: The locals love it, you won't
data.text: Ok place in a neat college town.  Went here for #2 son's B school graduation.  Ok place, Interesting waitor. Back staff was slow.  Wine list is off on the vintages.  Ok food, for kind of high pricea t$94 a head including a just average Barolo.

data.title: Still a favorite place
data.text:
This is still one of my top choices in Bloomington. I took staff here recently for an end of semester and pre-graduation dinner. Service was seamless and food was delicious. It remains a little upscale, limiting the clientele and the noise. I find it excellent for business. I had the duck confit salad as my entre and loved it. My manager had the Rabbit Cacciatore. You can not get rabbit just anywhere. We all thought it was delicious. She thought she would be taking left overs to her husband but finished every bite. One staff member had a burger and she did not leave any either after we all helped eat the heaping helping of fries.
Good place with a nice balance of price and value and good wines.

data.title: Stop Closing It!
data.text: I really love the food at Finch's and the atmosphere but I am so annoyed when they close down during IUB's breaks. I mean, come on! How many college students are paying your prices for your meals? Seriously? Townies and visitors would be far more likely to buy your wood fired pizzas, small plates, pastas, and entrees than college students. The quality of the food matches the prices and honestly, we'd go there more often if you were only open during holiday breaks and more regularly in the summer.

owner_response.author: france799, Owner at Finch's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Good day, Tammyjo~
Thank you for writing about Finch's, I am so happy that you love our food! I wanted to respond to your comments on being closed, I too, feel like it is a treat to stay open during the IUBreaks because we get to see some regulars that only come out when the town slows down a bit. (And they can find parking!) We only close in early January for repairs, otherwise, we stay open! We close for lunch service during Thanksgiving break and Spring break, but we are always open for dinner service. We have had a rehearsal dinner or local corporate event that will rent out the whole restaurant, but that is rare. I am so sorry if you came and pulled on the door only to find we were not open! I know that is frustrating. Please accept my apology and know that we try to stay open to accommodate our locals! Next time you are at the Brasserie introduce yourself, 
I would love to say hello!
All my best,
Candace Finch
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Tasty food with good beer selection
data.text: I've eaten at several places in Bloomington and this is one of my favorites so far.  The atmosphere is clean and nice.  The service was very good.  They had a variety of beers and an extensive wine list.  The food is fresh from the farm, and cooked to perfection.  I had lamb stew over pasta, which was flavorful and melted in my mouth.  My vegetarian daughter had a black bean burger with a side of mixed greens, which she said was tasty. The prices are a little higher than a college student's budget may allow, but a good place to eat when the parents are in town and buying.  We will definitely be going back again.

data.title: Helpful and Flavorful
data.text:
Eight of us (five university students) had a very nice meal at Finch's.  I booked the reservation very late (Saturday morning of the reservation) but the staff was very helpful in finding us a table.  We arrived on time and were seated right away.  The Restaurant was full, but didn't feel too crowded.  

The beer list was well thought out, with 7 or so craft brews on tap and a huge selection of bottle/can brews.  There was a fairly larger wine list; although, I didn't take a peek as none in our party was interested in wine.

The menu appeared to be typical American (with a little French influence), but with a twist.  As an example, my wife had Rabbit Cacciatore, a pasta dish, that she really enjoyed.  My youngest son had a wood fired pizza and it disappeared quickly.   My Snapper, the fish of the day, was very nice and very flavorful.

Our wait staff was efficient and very helpful in understanding menu offerings.  

I'm certain we will be back.

data.title: Simply the Best
data.text: Look, I worked in the restaurant industry in Bloomington for 8 years and there's no place better than Finch's. You will get the best steak, mussels, rotating freshly caught fish, pizza, beer, salads, desserts... you get the drift. Oh did I mention the pizza and beer? With an always rotating draft selection and the 2nd best selection of bottles (only to No Coast Reserve) you can pair the best gourmet pizza in town with a one-of-a-kind ale. Truly an amazing dining experience, complemented by well-trained staff. Would recommend to anyone.

data.title: Overpriced, poor kitchen service
data.text: Visiting for the first time. Read about it in Bloomington tourism magazine. Sounded good. But received poor service by waitress and too long of a wait time for dinner to arrive. Food tasted ok after we finally got it. But Nothing special. Plus $28 for roasted chicken does not mean a single chicken breast. I do no care if you are all organic. Manager offered free dessert, did not care for dessert but nothing else was offered. Atmosphere was disappointing as well. Redecorating is needed.
